trans-unit.source: Writes markup characters and text to an ASP.NET server control output stream.
This class provides formatting capabilities that ASP.NET server controls use when rendering markup to clients.
The HtmlTextWriter class is used to render HTML 4.0 to desktop browsers.

The HtmlTextWriter is also the base class for all markup writers in the <xref:System.Web.UI> namespace, including the <xref:System.Web.UI.ChtmlTextWriter>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Html32TextWriter>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.XhtmlTextWriter> classes.
These classes are used to write the elements, attributes, and style and layout information for different types of markup.
In addition, these classes are used by the page and control adapter classes that are associated with each markup language.
In most circumstances, ASP.NET automatically uses the appropriate writer for the requesting device.

However, if you create a custom text writer or if you want to specify a particular writer to render a page for a specific device, you must map the writer to the page in the `controlAdapters` section of the application .browser file.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> class that uses a default tab string.
The HtmlTextWriter overload of the HtmlTextWriter constructor uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.DefaultTabString> constant when indentation of a line is necessary.
It calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.%23ctor%28System.IO.TextWriter%2CSystem.String%29> overload to initialize the new instance.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> instance that renders the markup content.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> class with a specified tab string character.
The HtmlTextWriter overload of the HtmlTextWriter constructor uses `tabString` when indentation of a line is necessary.
It calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.%23ctor%28System.IFormatProvider%29?displayProperty=fullName> base constructor to initialize the new instance.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> that renders the markup content.
The string to use to render a line indentation.

Adds the specified markup attribute and value to the opening tag of the element that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object creates with a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
Use the AddAttribute overload of the AddAttribute method if the attribute is not one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> values, or if the attribute is not known until run time.
For an instance of any given markup element, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class maintains a list of attributes for that element.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is called, any attributes added by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method are rendered to the opening tag of the element.
The list of attributes is then cleared from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object.
The coding pattern for rendering markup elements is as follows: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method to add any attributes to the element.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
- Use other methods as needed to render the content found between the element's opening and closing tags.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
A string containing the name of the attribute to add.
A string containing the value to assign to the attribute.

Adds the markup attribute and the attribute value to the opening tag of the element that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object creates with a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
Use the AddAttribute overload of the AddAttribute method to render a standard markup attribute.
For an instance of any given markup element, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class maintains a list of attributes for that element.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is called, any attributes that are added by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method are rendered to the opening tag of the element.
The list of attributes is then cleared from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter>.
The coding pattern for rendering markup elements is as follows: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method to add any attributes to the element.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
- Use other methods as needed to render the content found between the element's opening and closing tags.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> that represents the markup attribute to add to the output stream.
A string containing the value to assign to the attribute.

Adds the specified markup attribute and value to the opening tag of the element that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object creates with a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method, with optional encoding.

Use the AddAttribute overload of the AddAttribute method if the attribute is not one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> values, or if the attribute is not known until run time and encoding is needed.
For an instance of any given markup element, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class maintains a list of attributes for that element.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is called, any attributes added by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method are rendered to the opening tag of the element.
The list of attributes is then cleared from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object.
Use the AddAttribute method with `fEncode` set to `true`, if the attribute can possibly contain a quotation mark ("), a less than sign (<), or an ampersand (&).
The method call will encode the attribute to meet the requirements of the requesting device.
You can set `fEncode` to `false`, if you know that none of these characters will be generated, or if you know that the attribute is already encoded.
The coding pattern for rendering markup elements is as follows: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method to add any attributes to the element.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
- Use other methods as needed to render the content found between the element's opening and closing tags.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
A string containing the name of the attribute to add.
A string containing the value to assign to the attribute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the attribute and its value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.

Adds the specified markup attribute and value, along with an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> enumeration value, to the opening tag of the element that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object creates with a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
Use the AddAttribute overload of the AddAttribute method only when inheriting from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class.
It enables you to create new `name` and `key` pairs for attributes.
A string containing the name of the attribute to add.
A string containing the value to assign to the attribute.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> that represents the attribute.

Adds the markup attribute and the attribute value to the opening tag of the element that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object creates with a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method, with optional encoding.
Use the AddAttribute overload of the AddAttribute method to render a standard markup attribute, with optional encoding.
For an instance of any given markup element, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class maintains a list of attributes for that element.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is called, any attributes added by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> are rendered to the opening tag of the element.
The list of attributes is then cleared from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object.
Use the AddAttribute method with `fEncode` set to `true`, if the attribute can possibly contain a quotation mark ("), a less than sign (<), or an ampersand (&).
The method call will encode the attribute to meet the requirements of the requesting device.
You can set `fEncode` to `false`, if you know that none of these characters will be generated, or if you know that the attribute is already encoded.
The coding pattern for rendering markup elements is as follows: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> method to add any attributes to the element.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
- Use other methods as needed to render the content found between the element's opening and closing tags.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> that represents the markup attribute to add to the output stream.
A string containing the value to assign to the attribute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the attribute and its value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Adds the specified markup style attribute and the attribute value to the opening markup tag created by a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
Use the AddStyleAttribute overload of the AddStyleAttribute method when the style is not a member of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration or is not known until run time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class maintains a list of styles for the markup elements it renders.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is called, any styles that are added by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddStyleAttribute%2A> method are rendered to the opening tag of the element.
The list of styles is then cleared.
The coding pattern for rendering markup elements is as follows: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddStyleAttribute%2A> method to add any style attributes to the element.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
- Use other methods as needed to render the content found between the element opening and closing tags.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
A string that contains the style attribute to add.
A string that contains the value to assign to the attribute.

Adds the markup style attribute associated with the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> value and the attribute value to the opening markup tag created by a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
Use the AddStyleAttribute overload of the AddStyleAttribute method when the style is a member of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration and is known before run time.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class maintains a list of styles for the markup elements it renders.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method is called, any styles added by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddStyleAttribute%2A> method are rendered to the opening tag of the element.
The list of styles is then cleared.
The coding pattern for rendering markup elements is as follows: - Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddStyleAttribute%2A> method to add any style attributes to the element.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
- Use other methods as needed to render the content found between the element opening and closing tags.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> that represents the style attribute to add to the output stream.
A string that contains the value to assign to the attribute.

Adds the specified markup style attribute and the attribute value, along with an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> enumeration value, to the opening markup tag created by a subsequent call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
Use the AddStyleAttribute overload of the AddStyleAttribute method only when inheriting from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class.
It enables you to create new `name` and `value` pairs for <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> attributes.
A string that contains the style attribute to be added.
A string that contains the value to assign to the attribute.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> that represents the style attribute to add.
Notifies an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object, or an object of a derived class, that a control is about to be rendered.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the BeginRender method has no functionality.
You must override the BeginRender method in a class derived from <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> to provide your own rendering functionality.

For example, in a markup language that might require `

` elements to be rendered immediately ahead of a control, but where the need for the `

` element is determined earlier, you could use the BeginRender override.
Closes the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object and releases any system resources associated with it.
This implementation of the Close method calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Close%2A?displayProperty=fullName> base method.
Following a call to the Close method, any operations on the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object might throw exceptions because all its resources have been released.
Represents a single tab character.
The single tab is represented by the ASCII 9 character.
To be added.
Represents the quotation mark (") character.
The DoubleQuoteChar field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteAttribute%2A> method to close an attribute.
To be added.
Encodes the value of the specified markup attribute based on the requirements of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> object of the current context.

Use the EncodeAttributeValue overload of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EncodeAttributeValue%28System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute%2CSystem.String%29> method if the attribute is not an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> enumeration value or is not known until run time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EncodeAttributeValue%2A> method removes double quotation marks ("), ampersands (&), and less than signs (<) so that invalid tags are not generated, regardless of the input.
The actual encoding is performed by the <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.HtmlAttributeEncode%2A> method.
A string containing the attribute value to encode.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the attribute value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
A string containing the encoded attribute value, if value is empty, or the unencoded attribute value if fEncode is .
Encodes the value of the specified markup attribute based on the requirements of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest"></xref> object of the current context.
The EncodeAttributeValue method removes double quotation marks ("), ampersands (&), and less than signs (<) so that invalid tags are not generated, regardless of the input.
The actual encoding is performed by the <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.HtmlAttributeEncode%2A> method.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> representing the markup attribute.
A string containing the attribute value to encode.
A string containing the encoded attribute value.
Performs minimal URL encoding by converting spaces in the specified URL to the string "%20".
URL encoding of a character consists of a percent symbol (%), followed by the two-digit hexadecimal representation (case-insensitive) of the ISO-Latin code point for the character.
The hexadecimal representation of a space is 20.
A string containing the URL to encode.
A string containing the encoded URL.
Gets the encoding that the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object uses to write content to the page.
The Encoding property obtains its value from the base <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> object.
The <xref:System.Text.Encoding> in which the markup is written to the page.
Notifies an <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object, or an object of a derived class, that a control has finished rendering.
You can use this method to close any markup elements opened in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.BeginRender*> method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the EndRender method has no functionality.
You must override EndRender in a class derived from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class to provide your own rendering functionality.
You can use the EndRender method to close any markup elements opened in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.BeginRender%2A> method.
Represents the left angle bracket and slash mark (</) of the closing tag of a markup element.
The EndTagLeftChars field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method to construct markup element end tags.
To be added.

Writes the opening tag of a <xref uid="langword_csharp_<span>" name="<span>" href=""></xref> element that contains attributes that implement the layout and character formatting of the specified style.
Use the EnterStyle method to apply styles, such as background color or border width, to a block of markup.
The EnterStyle and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter or control to create markup that uses the character formatting of the specified style.
Use the same value for `style` in the EnterStyle method that you use in the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> method.
The EnterStyle overload of the EnterStyle method renders the opening tag of a `<span>` element.
This method then adds the necessary attributes and style attributes to the opening tag of the `<span>` element to display the settings specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.

If you want to render a different markup element to contain the attributes and style attributes, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style%2CSystem.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag%29> overload.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that specifies the layout and formatting to begin applying to the block of markup.
Writes the opening tag of a markup element that contains attributes that implement the layout and character formatting of the specified style.
Use the EnterStyle method to apply styles, such as background color or border width, to a block of markup.
The EnterStyle and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter or control to create markup that uses the character formatting of the specified style.
Use the same value for `style` in the EnterStyle method that you use in the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.ExitStyle%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> overload of the EnterStyle method renders the opening tag of the element specified by the `tag` parameter.

The EnterStyle method then adds the necessary attributes and style attributes to the opening tag of the element to display the settings that are specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style%29> overload to render the opening tag of a `<span>` element.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that specifies the layout and formatting to begin applying to the block of markup.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> that specifies the opening tag of the markup element that will contain the style object specified in `style`.
Represents the equal sign (<xref uid="langword_csharp_=" name="=" href=""></xref>).
You might want to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EqualsDoubleQuoteString> field instead of the EqualsChar field when constructing the opening delimiter of an attribute value.
To be added.
Represents an equal sign (=) and a double quotation mark (") together in a string (=").

The EqualsDoubleQuoteString field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteAttribute%2A> methods to construct the opening delimiter of attribute values.
To be added.
Writes the closing tag of a <xref uid="langword_csharp_<span>" name="<span>" href=""></xref> element to end the specified layout and character formatting.

The ExitStyle overload of the ExitStyle method renders the closing tag of a `<span>` element after the closing tag of the control, closing the element opened by the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> call.

The ExitStyle and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter or control to create markup that begins and ends a block by using the character formatting of the specified style.
Use the same value for `style` in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> method that you use in the corresponding ExitStyle method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that specifies the layout and formatting to close.
Writes the closing tag of the specified markup element to end the specified layout and character formatting.

The ExitStyle overload of the ExitStyle method renders the closing tag of the element that is specified by `tag` after the closing tag of the control, closing the element that was opened by the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style%2CSystem.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag%29> method call.

The ExitStyle and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> methods allow a device adapter or control to create markup that begins and ends a block by using the character formatting of the specified style.
Use the same value for `style` in the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle%2A> method that you use in the corresponding ExitStyle method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> that specifies the layout and formatting to stop applying to the output text.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> that specifies the closing tag of the markup element that contained the attributes that applied the specified style.
This must match the key passed in the corresponding <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.EnterStyle*> call.
Removes all the markup and style attributes on all properties of the page or Web server control.
Before attributes are rendered on a markup element, the FilterAttributes method is called.

In turn, the FilterAttributes method calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.OnAttributeRender%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.OnStyleAttributeRender%2A> methods for each attribute and style to render.
Clears all buffers for the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object and causes any buffered data to be written to the output stream.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the Flush method just calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Flush%2A> base method.
Obtains the corresponding <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> enumeration value for the specified attribute.
If `attrName` is `null` or an empty string (""), or cannot be found in the table of attribute names, the value -1, typed to an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> object, is returned.
A string that contains the attribute for which to obtain the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> enumeration value for the specified attribute; otherwise, an invalid <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> value if the attribute is not a member of the enumeration.
Obtains the name of the markup attribute associated with the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> value.
The GetAttributeName method returns an empty string (""), if `attrKey` is not a valid <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> value.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> to obtain the markup attribute name for.
A string containing the name of the markup attribute.
Obtains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> enumeration value for the specified style.

The GetStyleKey method returns the value -1 typed as a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> value, if `styleName` does not correspond to any <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> enumeration value.
The style attribute for which to obtain the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref>.
The enumeration value corresponding to styleName.
Obtains the markup style attribute name associated with the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> enumeration value.
If `styleKey` is not a valid <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> object, the GetStyleName method returns an empty string ("").
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> to obtain the style attribute name for.
The style attribute name associated with the enumeration value specified in styleKey.
Obtains the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> enumeration value associated with the specified markup element.
If `tagName` is `null`, an empty string (""), or cannot be found in the table of markup tag names, the GetTagKey method returns the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag> field.
The markup element for which to obtain the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref>.
The enumeration value; otherwise, if tagName is not associated with a specific value, .
Obtains the markup element associated with the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> enumeration value.
If `tagKey` is not a valid <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag> value, the GetTagName method returns an empty string ("").
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> to obtain the markup element for.
A string representing the markup element.
Gets or sets the number of tab positions to indent the beginning of each line of markup.

Indentation is performed by writing the string that is specified by the `tabString` parameter of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.%23ctor%28System.IO.TextWriter%2CSystem.String%29> constructor the number of times that are specified by the Indent property.
If the Indent property is set to a negative value, it is changed to 0 before being saved.
The number of tab positions to indent each line.
Gets or sets the text writer that writes the inner content of the markup element.
Inner markup content is the text found between the opening and closing tags of a markup language element.
If the InnerWriter property is set to a <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> object that is an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpWriter> class, this fact is noted and a separate reference is saved.
A <xref:System.IO.TextWriter> that writes the inner markup content.
Determines whether the specified markup attribute and its value are rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.

To obtain the value to be assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.IsAttributeDefined%28System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute%2CSystem.String%40%29> overload instead of this one.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> associated with the markup attribute.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the attribute is rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified markup attribute and its value are rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
If the IsAttributeDefined method returns `true`, the value to be assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute> object is returned in the `value` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> associated with the markup attribute.
The value assigned to the attribute.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the attribute is rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified markup style attribute is rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.

To get the value that will be rendered with the specified style attribute, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.IsStyleAttributeDefined%28System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle%2CSystem.String%40%29> overload of the IsStyleAttributeDefined method.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> associated with the attribute.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the attribute will be rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified markup style attribute and its value are rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method.
If the IsStyleAttributeDefined method returns `true`, the value to be assigned to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle> attribute is returned in the `value` parameter.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> associated with the attribute.
The value assigned to the style attribute.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the attribute and its value will be rendered during the next call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag*> method; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Checks an attribute to ensure that it can be rendered in the opening tag of a <xref uid="langword_csharp_<form>" name="<form>" href=""></xref> markup element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the IsValidFormAttribute method returns `true` for all attributes.
Override the IsValidFormAttribute to limit the attributes that can be rendered in the opening tag of a `<form>` element.
A string that contains the name of the attribute to check.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the line terminator string used by the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref> object.
The line terminator string used by the current <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter"></xref>.
Determines whether the specified markup attribute and its value can be rendered to the current markup element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the OnAttributeRender method always returns `true`.
The OnAttributeRender overrides can determine whether an attribute will be rendered to the page.
A string containing the name of the attribute to render.
A string containing the value that is assigned to the attribute.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> associated with the markup attribute.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified markup style attribute and its value can be rendered to the current markup element.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the OnStyleAttributeRender method always returns `true`.
The OnStyleAttributeRender overrides can determine whether a style attribute will be rendered to the page.
A string containing the name of the style attribute to render.
A string containing the value that is assigned to the style attribute.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> associated with the style attribute.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Determines whether the specified markup element will be rendered to the requesting page.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class implementation of the OnTagRender method always returns `true`.
The OnTagRender overrides can determine whether an element will be rendered to the page.
A string containing the name of the element to render.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> associated with the element.
Always <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Writes a series of tab strings that represent the indentation level for a line of markup characters.
Removes the most recently saved markup element from the list of rendered elements.
Elements are added to the list of rendered markup elements by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method removes markup elements from the list by calling the PopEndTag method.
A <xref:System.String> containing the most recently rendered markup element.
The list of rendered elements is empty.
Saves the specified markup element for later use when generating the end tag for a markup element.
Elements are added to the list of rendered markup elements when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method calls the PushEndTag method.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method removes markup elements from the list after it renders the end tag for the element.
The closing tag of the markup element.
Registers markup attributes, whether literals or dynamically generated, from the source file so that they can be properly rendered to the requesting client.
The predefined attributes of the HTML markup language are registered by calls to the RegisterAttribute method when the first <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object is created.
Dynamic attributes can be registered by using the RegisterAttribute method at other times.
The registration table used by the RegisterAttribute method is `static`, so registration of attributes applies to all <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> objects on the host computer.
A string containing the name of the markup attribute to register.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterAttribute"></xref> that corresponds with the attribute name.
Registers markup style properties, whether literals or dynamically generated, from the source file so that they can be properly rendered to the requesting client.

The predefined cascading style sheet (CSS) attributes of the HTML markup language are registered by calls to the RegisterStyle method when the first <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object is created.
Dynamic style attributes can be registered by using the RegisterStyle method at other times.
The registration table used by the RegisterStyle method is `static`, so registration of attributes applies to all <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> objects on the host computer.
The string passed from the source file specifying the style name.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterStyle"></xref> that corresponds with the specified style.
Registers markup tags, whether literals or dynamically generated, from the source file so that they can be properly rendered to the requesting client.
The predefined markup tags of the HTML language are registered by calls to the RegisterTag method when the first <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> object is created.
Dynamic markup tags can be registered by using the RegisterTag method at other times.
The registration table used by the RegisterTag method is `static`, so registration of tags applies to all <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> objects on the host computer.
A string that contains the HTML tag.
An <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> that specifies which element to render.
Writes any text or spacing that occurs after the content and before the closing tag of the markup element to the markup output stream.
The RenderAfterContent method can be useful if you want to insert child elements into the current markup element.
A string that contains the spacing or text to write after the content of the element.
Writes any spacing or text that occurs after the closing tag for a markup element.
The RenderAfterTag method can be useful if you want to render additional closing tags after the element tag.
The spacing or text to write after the closing tag of the element.
Writes any text or spacing before the content and after the opening tag of a markup element.
The RenderBeforeContent method can be useful if you want to insert child elements into the current markup element before the inner markup.
The text or spacing to write prior to the content of the element.
If not overridden, RenderBeforeContent returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Writes any text or spacing that occurs before the opening tag of a markup element.
The RenderBeforeTag method can be useful if you want to render additional opening tags before the opening tag of the intended element.
The text or spacing to write before the markup element opening tag.
If not overridden, <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
Writes the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
Use the RenderBeginTag override of the RenderBeginTag method, if the markup element is not one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag> enumeration values.

To generate a markup element by using the RenderBeginTag method, first call the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddStyleAttribute%2A> methods, as necessary, to specify any element attributes or style attributes that are to appear in the opening tag of the element.
After generating the inner markup, call the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method to generate the closing tag.
A string containing the name of the markup element for which to render the opening tag.
Writes the opening tag of the markup element associated with the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> enumeration value to the output stream.
Use the RenderBeginTag overload of the RenderBeginTag method if the markup element is of a known type that is one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag> enumeration values.

To generate a markup element by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method, first call the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddAttribute%2A> and the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.AddStyleAttribute%2A> methods, as necessary, to specify any element attributes or style attributes that are to appear in the opening tag of the element.
After generating the inner markup, call the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method to generate the closing tag.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> values that defines the opening tag of the markup element to render.
Writes the end tag of a markup element to the output stream.

Call the RenderEndTag method after the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> overload is called and after all content between the opening and closing tags (inner markup) of the element has been rendered.
Represents a space and the self-closing slash mark (/) of a markup tag.
The SelfClosingChars field is used in markup elements that are self-closed.
For example: `<input type="submit" value="go" />`
To be added.
Represents the closing slash mark and right angle bracket (/>) of a self-closing markup element.
The SelfClosingTagEnd field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method when constructing self-closing markup elements.
To be added.
Represents the semicolon (;).
Pass the SemicolonChar field as the parameter argument in a <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.Write%2A> method call when you want to render a semicolon from a custom control or adapter.
To be added.
Represents an apostrophe (').
Use the SingleQuoteChar field when it is necessary to render an apostrophe.
To be added.
Represents the slash mark (/).
Use the SlashChar field to render the slash marks when you write a URL.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteEndTag%2A> method uses the SlashChar field when writing the closing tag of a markup element.
To be added.
Represents a space ( ) character.

The SpaceChar field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteAttribute%2A> methods when writing separators between elements and attributes.
To be added.
Represents the style equals (<xref uid="langword_csharp_:" name=":" href=""></xref>) character used to set style attributes equal to values.
The StyleEqualsChar field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteStyleAttribute%2A> method to delimit style names and values.
To be added.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriterTag"></xref> value for the specified markup element.
The TagKey property is of use only to classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class.
You should read or set the TagKey property only in a call to the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method; this is the only time it is set to a consistent value.
The markup element that is having its opening tag rendered.
The property value cannot be set.
Represents the opening angle bracket (<) of a markup tag.

The TagLeftChar field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteBeginTag%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteFullBeginTag%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteEndTag%2A> methods when writing markup tags.
To be added.
Gets or sets the tag name of the markup element being rendered.
The TagName property is of use only to classes that inherit from the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter> class.
You should read or set the TagName property only in <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A> method calls; this is the only time it is set to a consistent value.
The tag name of the markup element being rendered.
Represents the closing angle bracket (>) of a markup tag.

The TagRightChar field is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderBeginTag%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteFullBeginTag%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteEndTag%2A> methods when writing markup tags.
To be added.
Writes the text representation of a Boolean value to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The <xref:System.Boolean> to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of a Unicode character to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The Unicode character to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of an array of Unicode characters to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The array of Unicode characters to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of a double-precision floating-point number to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The double-precision floating-point number to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of a 32-byte signed integer to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The 32-byte signed integer to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of a 64-byte signed integer to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The 64-byte signed integer to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of an object to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The object to write to the output stream.
Writes the text representation of a single-precision floating-point number to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The single-precision floating-point number to write to the output stream.
Writes the specified string to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The string to write to the output stream.
Writes a tab string and a formatted string to the output stream, using the same semantics as the <xref:System.String.Format%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
A string that contains zero or more format items.
An object to format.
Writes a formatted string that contains the text representation of an object array to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
This method uses the same semantics as the <xref:System.String.Format%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
A string that contains zero or more format items.
An object array to format.
Writes the text representation of a subarray of Unicode characters to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
The array of characters from which to write text to the output stream.
The index location in the array where writing begins.
The number of characters to write to the output stream.
Writes a formatted string that contains the text representation of two objects to the output stream, along with any pending tab spacing.
This method uses the same semantics as the <xref:System.String.Format%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
The Write method generates any tabs that are pending, and then calls the <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.Write%2A> base method.
A string that contains zero or more format items.
An object to format.
An object to format.
Writes the specified markup attribute and value to the output stream.
Use the WriteAttribute method to write markup attributes and their values with no encoding.
The WriteAttribute method writes the attribute value enclosed in double quotation marks (").
If `value` is `null`, the WriteAttribute method writes only the attribute name.
The attribute to write to the output stream.
The value assigned to the attribute.
Writes the specified markup attribute and value to the output stream, and, if specified, writes the value encoded.
Use the WriteAttribute method to write markup attributes and their values with or without encoding.
The WriteAttribute method uses the <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.HtmlAttributeEncode%2A> method to do the encoding.
The WriteAttribute method writes the attribute value enclosed in double quotation marks (").
If `value` is `null`, the WriteAttribute method writes only the attribute name.
The markup attribute to write to the output stream.
The value assigned to the attribute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the attribute and its assigned value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.
The WriteBeginTag method does not write the closing angle bracket (>) of the markup element's opening tag.
This allows the writing of markup attributes to the opening tag of the element.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.TagRightChar> constant to close the opening tag when calling the WriteBeginTag method.
Use the WriteBeginTag method with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.SelfClosingTagEnd> constant when you write markup elements that are self-closing.
The WriteBeginTag method is used by custom server controls that do not allow tag or attribute mapping and render markup elements in the same way for each request.
The markup element of which to write the opening tag.
Writes a <xref uid="langword_csharp_<br />" name="<br />" href=""></xref> markup element to the output stream.
Use the WriteBreak method to render line breaks in custom control or adapter markup.
The WriteBreak method writes a space between the `br` and `/` for improved HTML compatibility.
Encodes the specified text for the requesting device, and then writes it to the output stream.
The text string to encode and write to the output stream.
text is .
Encodes the specified URL, and then writes it to the output stream.
The URL might include parameters.
The WriteEncodedUrl method encodes the string in the `url` parameter in accordance with the specification for URL encoding.
The parameters that follow the question mark (?) delimiter are not encoded.
The URL string to encode and write to the output stream.
Encodes the specified URL parameter for the requesting device, and then writes it to the output stream.
Spaces in the parameter part of a URL are encoded as plus signs (+), and equal signs (=) are encoded as `%3d`.
The URL parameter string to encode and write to the output stream.
Writes any tab spacing and the closing tag of the specified markup element.
Unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.RenderEndTag%2A> method, the WriteEndTag method has no logic to make the element end tag match the corresponding opening tag.
The element to write the closing tag for.
Writes any tab spacing and the opening tag of the specified markup element to the output stream.

The WriteFullBeginTag method automatically writes the closing angle bracket (>) of the opening tag of the element, unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteBeginTag%2A> method, which does not write the closing angle bracket.
Use WriteFullBeginTag for markup elements that have no attributes.
The element to write to the output stream.
Writes a line terminator string to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
For more information, see <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A>.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a Boolean value, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The Boolean to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and a Unicode character, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The character to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and an array of Unicode characters, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The character array to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a double-precision floating-point number, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The double-precision floating-point number to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a 32-byte signed integer, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The 32-byte signed integer to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a 64-byte signed integer, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The 64-byte signed integer to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of an object, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The object to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a single-precision floating-point number, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The single-precision floating point number to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and a text string, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The string to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and the text representation of a 4-byte unsigned integer, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The 4-byte unsigned integer to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and a formatted string containing the text representation of an object, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The WriteLine method uses the same semantics as the <xref:System.String.Format%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
A string containing zero or more format items.
An object to format.
Writes any pending tab spacing and a formatted string that contains the text representation of an object array, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The WriteLine method uses the same semantics as the [Format(String, Object\[\])](assetId:///M:System.String.Format(System.String,System.Object[])?qualifyHint=False&autoUpgrade=False) method.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` method.
A string containing zero or more format items.
An object array to format.
Writes any pending tab spacing and a subarray of Unicode characters, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
The character array from which to write text to the output stream.
The location in the character array where writing begins.
The number of characters in the array to write to the output stream.
Writes any pending tab spacing and a formatted string that contains the text representation of two objects, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
The default line terminator string is a carriage return followed by a line feed ("\r ").
The WriteLine method uses the same semantics as the <xref:System.String.Format%28System.String%2CSystem.Object%2CSystem.Object%29> method.
The <xref:System.IO.TextWriter.WriteLine%2A> base method is used to write the `value` parameter.
A string containing zero or more format items.
An object to format.
An object to format.
Writes a string, followed by a line terminator string, to the output stream.
This method ignores any specified tab spacing.
The string to write to the output stream.
Writes the specified style attribute to the output stream.
The WriteStyleAttribute method writes the style attribute in the following form: `name` `=` `value` `;`
The style attribute to write to the output stream.
The value assigned to the style attribute.
Writes the specified style attribute and value to the output stream, and encodes the value, if specified.

The WriteStyleAttribute method writes the style attribute in the following form: `name` `=` `value` `;` The <xref:System.Web.HttpUtility.HtmlAttributeEncode%2A> method is used to encode the `value` parameter.
The style attribute to write to the output stream.
The value assigned to the style attribute.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the style attribute and its assigned value; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Writes the specified string, encoding it according to URL requirements.

The WriteUrlEncodedString method encodes characters that could be considered URL delimiters (dependent on the setting of `argument`) into strings of the form `%``xx`, if the ASCII code is less than 128; otherwise, `%u``xxxx`, where `x` is a hexadecimal digit.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteEncodedUrl%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter.WriteEncodedUrlParameter%2A> methods use the WriteUrlEncodedString method as a utility method.
The string to encode and write to the output stream.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> to encode the string as a part of the parameter section of the URL; <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref> to encode the string as part of the path section of the URL.
